intro: Hieracium caledonicum subsp. veterascens, commonly known as the Caledonian hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the Scottish Highlands. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a single stem. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in mountainous regions. It has a hairy stem and lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. This subspecies is part of the dandelion family (Asteraceae) and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
